intro: Minuartia aucta, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers in early spring, typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually linear or oblanceolate, and it is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Minuartia aucta is a perennial species that is widespread across Europe, Asia, and North America.
